title: 2004 - The Year's Best Science Fiction Volume 21
description:
The stories in this collection imaginatively take readers far across the universe, into the very core of their beings, to the realm of the Gods, and to the moment just after now. Included are the works of masters of the form and the bright new talents of tomorrow. This book is a valuable resource in addition to serving as the single best place in the universe to find stories that stir the imagination and the heart.

01) Summation: 2003 by Gardner Dozois
02) Off on a Starship by William Barton
03) It's All True by John Kessel
04) Rogue Farm by Charles Stross
05) The Ice by Steven Popkes
06) EJ-ES by Nancy Kress
07) The Bellman by John Varley
08) The Bear's Baby by Judith Moffett
09) Calling Your Name by Howard Waldrop
10) June Sixteenth at Anna's by Kristine Kathryn Rusch
11) The Green Leopard Plague by Walter Jon Williams
12) The Fluted Girl by Paolo Bacigalupi
13) Dead Worlds by Jack Skillingstead
14) King Dragon by Michael Swanwick
15) Singletons in Love by Paul Melko
16) Anomalous Structures of My Dreams by M. Shayne Bell
17) The Cookie Monster by Vernor Vinge
18) Joe Steele by Harry Turtledove
19) Birth Days by Geoff Ryman
20) Awake in the Night by John C. Wright
21) The Long Way Home by James Van Pelt
22) The Eyes of America by Geoffrey A. Landis
23) Welcome to Olympus, Mr. Hearst by Kage Baker
24) Night of Time by Robert Reed
25) Strong Medicine by William Shunn
26) Send Me a Mentagram by Dominic Green
27) And the Dish Ran Away With the Spoon by Paul Di Filippo
28) Flashmen by Terry Dowling
29) Dragonhead by Nicholas A. DiChario
30) Dear Abbey by Terry Bisson
31) Honorable Mentions: 2003 by Gardner Dozois


Format: M4A
Bitrate: 32 Kbps
Unabridged
